      i think it ties into the fact that actually everything has happened before. perhaps it's more strange that we are ever able to NOT feel like something is familiar

      there are so many more things to be done besides 'a video.' just want to make sure i get a handle on what my options are before making a schedule. but a schedule is imminent, and usually comes about by surprise

9.13.19  11:33 am   Something that got you excited today and want to rant about it?

      puddles are very difficult to spill

9.13.19  11:23 am   Should i quit school?

      yes but you're gonna have to make your own school

9.13.19  11:15 am   have you written any other music since you started working on the video or have the past 5 months been solely devoted to this project

      i wrote song, recorded it, finished it to the final mix. done. then started a video for it, but for some reason, there was a little voice in my head that told me to instead of using the 3D program for just little bits of the video, how about using it for the entire thing. well, for those of you who don't know, 3D video usually takes 100,000 years longer than anyone would ever imagine. but another interesting thing about 3D, is that it seems like the whole universe has just opened up. in ways that i have only dreamed about. vast new world. resonating strongly with filmmaking desires i've probably had since childhood but never admitted it, because 3D graphics has never really been anything that 1 person alone could really delve into, perhaps until this generation. so i'd say it was about 2 solid months down the rabbit hole of working on that music video, which really was turning out to the most exciting thing i had ever worked on. then it began to occur to me that now is a better time than ever to upgrade to a much newer system, because the reason i had waited was because my previous full time video software was long ago discontinued, and literally only worked on old computers. so i've been stuck on an old computer system for many years. given that i found myself now working on different software (the 3D one) which is not discontinued, it began to occur to me that the big shift is imminent. then a series of events unfolded that suddenly plunged me into the shift. and in the process, a thousand more doors and windows have begun to open. the possibilities are wildly beyond my greatest imagination. an interesting twist is, my entire old method no longer works on this new system (at least for video. for music everything's pretty much still intact, with all the benefit of the new system.) the old video system is still available on an ancient computer in the corner, but let's face it, the new possibilities wipe the old system off the map

9.13.19  9:12 am   did you notice that over time people seem to be asking you more and more about transcriptions and transcribing skills, what's the thing with transcriptions these days that everyone is talking about this?

      i'm not sure, but i certainly did quite a lot of it while i was learning

9.13.19  9:10 am   where does your obsession with brass stabs come from

      i've found it's the only way to play that fake trumpet that sounds any good. i used to not use that instrument at all, because i didn't think i could get anything good out of it. but in early 2015 i was doing some in depth experiments with instrument randomization (pick random instrument, THEN, you figure out (non-randomly) where in the song it fits. anywhere. beginning, end, bar 10.5 of verse 2, find a place to fit it in.) the trumpet came up, as a classic 'you're fucked' moment, but because of the nature of the experiment i was challeneged to find a spot for it, and there was one place sort of near the climax of the song, that, sure enough, it worked, played as short chord stabs. change my whole world up, and i've been using it in a similar manner ever since. usually having a tendency to find the exact only spot it would work

9.13.19  8:58 am   Bill, have you transcended time and space? 

      everyone sort of has one foot in and one foot out. that's what actually makes the whole system work, at least that's the best way i understand it

9.13.19  8:27 am   Did you ever figure out the things you can't explain

      yes, it's fun to do that

9.13.19  2:21 am   would you rather invent time travel or teleportation

      teleportation. time travel is already invented, in fact it can't be stopped

9.13.19  2:21 am   best way to edit drafts of songs? i have so many drafts. i need to make them into actual things right now they are like stream of consciousness stuff. or should i just keep generating content until i feel like molding it and editing it into actual songs? i don't know what to do or what i want except i guess to feel happier / more content 

      put every item into a list / inventory, so you know what you have. then, by some method, (chronologically, randomized, .... your choice), go through each one and open up a conversation about it, talk about it. think about the origins of it. and then just diagnose whatever seems to be getting in the way of it expressing that true original purpose. then start from the beginning, and keep starting again from the beginning and stop whenever it's not good enough. and keep working on it until the whole thing is good all the way through. sometimes you need time to pass before getting a new clean run through, but sometimes i can trick my mind into a reset by touching the door of the room i'm in, and returning
